topic: Tailwind CSS Master CSS Framework Declaration

declaration.title: Tailwind CSS is the MASTER CSS Framework

rules.primary_rule: Tailwind CSS is the ONLY CSS framework allowed in this project
required_usage: ALL styling must use Tailwind utility classes
@apply directive in CSS files (only in @layer base)

allowed: @layer base for browser native controls (select/option) - !important required
Custom CSS for third-party library overrides (only when Tailwind cannot handle)
Animation keyframes (if Tailwind animation utilities insufficient)
forbidden: Custom CSS classes that duplicate Tailwind functionality
Global CSS rules that override Tailwind utilities
!important in global CSS (except browser native controls)

button.example: px-4 py-2.5 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded-lg hover:bg-blue-700 hover:scale-105 active:scale-95 focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 transition-all duration-200

form_input.pattern: Tailwind utility classes with focus states
form_input.example: w-full px-4 py-2.5 border border-gray-300 dark:border-gray-600 rounded-lg bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 text-gray-900 dark:text-white focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 transition-all duration-200

card.pattern: Tailwind utility classes with shadows and borders
card.example: bg-white dark:bg-gray-800 rounded-xl shadow-lg border border-gray-200 dark:border-gray-700 transition-all duration-300 hover:shadow-xl

badge.pattern: Tailwind utility classes with color variants

new_code.review: Code review will reject non-Tailwind CSS

existing_code.enforcement: When editing existing files, migrate to Tailwind

legacy_code.enforcement: No forced migration for untouched files
legacy_code.note: But ALL new code must use Tailwind
